symbols.title: namespace sap.suite.ui.microchart

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.AreaMicroChart
symbols.description: Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: colorPalette
properties.description: The color palette for the chart. If this property is set, semantic colors defined in AreaMicroChartItem are ignored. As a result, colors of the palette are assigned to each line. When all the palette colors are used up, assignment of the colors starts again from the beginning of the palette.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description:
If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed or by the width and height property.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.60. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: maxXValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it indicates the value the X-axis ends with.

properties.name: maxYValue
properties.description: If this property is set it indicates the value X axis ends with.

properties.name: minXValue
properties.description: If this property is set it indicates the value X axis ends with.

properties.name: minYValue
properties.description: If this property is set it indicates the value X axis ends with.

properties.name: showLabel
properties.description: Determines if the labels are displayed or not.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the bullet micro chart is included.

properties.name: view
properties.description: The view of the chart.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: chart
aggregations.description: The configuration of the actual values line. The color property defines the color of the line. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

aggregations.name: firstXLabel
aggregations.description: The label on X axis for the first point of the chart.

aggregations.name: firstYLabel
aggregations.description: The label on Y axis for the first point of the chart.

aggregations.name: innerMaxThreshold
aggregations.description: The configuration of the upper line of the inner threshold area. The color property defines the color of the area between inner thresholds. For rendering of the inner threshold area, both innerMaxThreshold and innerMinThreshold aggregations must be defined. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

aggregations.name: innerMinThreshold
aggregations.description: The configuration of the bottom line of the inner threshold area. The color property is ignored. For rendering of the inner threshold area, both innerMaxThreshold and innerMinThreshold aggregations must be defined. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

aggregations.name: lastXLabel
aggregations.description: The label on X axis for the last point of the chart.

aggregations.name: lastYLabel
aggregations.description: The label on Y axis for the last point of the chart.

aggregations.name: lines
aggregations.description: The set of lines.

aggregations.name: maxLabel
aggregations.description: The label for the maximum point of the chart.

aggregations.name: maxThreshold
aggregations.description: The configuration of the max threshold area. The color property defines the color of the area above the max threshold line. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

aggregations.name: minLabel
aggregations.description: The label for the minimum point of the chart.

aggregations.name: minThreshold
aggregations.description: The configuration of the min threshold area. The color property defines the color of the area below the min threshold line. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

aggregations.name: target
aggregations.description: The configuration of the target values line. The color property defines the color of the line. Points are rendered in the same sequence as in this aggregation.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

Since: 1.60.0.

constructor.description:

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart
symbols.description:
Displays a colored horizontal bar representing a current value on top of a background bar representing the compared value. The vertical bars can represent the numeric values, the scaling factors, the thresholds, and the target values. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.BulletChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: actualValueLabel
properties.description: If set, displays a specified label instead of the numeric actual value.

properties.name: deltaValueLabel
properties.description: If set, displays a specified label instead of the calculated numeric delta value.

properties.name: forecastValue
properties.description: The forecast value that is displayed in Actual mode only. If set, the forecast value bar appears in the background of the actual value bar.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description:
If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed or by the width and height property.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.58. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: maxValue
properties.description: The maximum scale value for the bar chart used for defining a fixed size of the scale in different instances of this control.

properties.name: minValue
properties.description: The minimum scale value for the bar chart used for defining a fixed size of the scale in different instances of this control.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: The mode of displaying the actual value itself or the delta between the actual value and the target value. If not set, the actual value is displayed.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scaling suffix that is added to all values.

properties.name: scaleColor
properties.description: The background color of the scale. The theming is enabled only for the default value of this property.

properties.name: showActualValue
properties.description: If set to true, shows the numeric actual value. This property works in Actual mode only.

properties.name: showActualValueInDeltaMode
properties.description: If set to true, shows the numeric actual value and possibly hides the delta value, if showDeltaValue is set to true. This property works in Delta mode only and has priority over showDeltaValue.

properties.name: showDeltaValue
properties.description: If set to true, shows the calculated delta value instead of the numeric actual value regardless of the showActualValue setting. This property works in Delta mode only.

properties.name: showTargetValue
properties.description: If set to true, shows the numeric target value.

properties.name: showThresholds
properties.description: If set to true, shows the threshold markers.

properties.name: showValueMarker
properties.description: If set to true, shows the value marker.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the bullet micro chart is included.

properties.name: smallRangeAllowed
properties.description:
If set to True, the control allows small value ranges for comparing different values. The minimum value of the value range is not taken as 0.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: targetValue
properties.description: The target value that is displayed as a black vertical bar.

properties.name: targetValueLabel
properties.description: If set, displays a specified label instead of the numeric target value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: actual
aggregations.description: Actual data of the BulletMicroChart.

aggregations.name: thresholds
aggregations.description: Threshold data of the BulletMicroChart.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:

Since: 1.60.0.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ColumnMicroChart
symbols.description:
Compares different values which are represented as vertical bars. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ColumnMicroChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: allowColumnLabels
properties.description:
If set to true and there is enough space, top labels of the chart are hidden and labels for each column are shown instead.

* @since 1.60.0

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

properties.description:
If set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed. Size, width and height properties are ignored in this case.

This enum is part of the 'sap/suite/ui/microchart/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'CommonBackgroundType'.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChart
symbols.description:
Illustrates values as colored bar charts with title, numeric value, and scaling factor in the content area. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.ComparisonChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: colorPalette
properties.description: The color palette for the chart. If this property is set, semantic colors defined in ComparisonData are ignored. Colors from the palette are assigned to each bar consequentially. When all the palette colors are used, assignment of the colors begins from the first palette color.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description:
If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed. Size and Width properties are ignored in such case.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.58. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: maxValue
properties.description:
The maximum scale value for the chart used to define the value range of the scale for comparing different values.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: minValue
properties.description:
The minimum scale value for the chart used to define the value range of the scale for comparing different values.

Since: 1.42.0.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scaling suffix that is added to the actual and target values.

properties.name: shrinkable
properties.description: If it is set to true, the height of the control is defined by its content.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the bullet micro chart is included.

properties.name: view
properties.description: The view of the chart. If not set, the Normal view is used by default.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: data
aggregations.description: The comparison chart bar data.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

Since: 1.60.0.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartViewType
symbols.description:
Lists the views of the comparison micro chart concerning the position of titles and labels.

This enum is part of the 'sap/suite/ui/microchart/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ComparisonMicroChartViewType'.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartViewType.Normal
properties.description: Titles and values are displayed above the bars.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartViewType.Responsive
properties.description: Behavior changes based on the current width of the chart. Normal view is used for charts up to 192px wide, and Wide is used for wider charts.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.ComparisonMicroChartViewType.Wide
properties.description: Titles and values are displayed in the same line with the bars.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChart
symbols.description:
Represents the delta of two values as a chart. This control replaces the deprecated sap.suite.ui.commons.DeltaMicroChart.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The semantic color of the delta value. For SAPUI5 1.x releases, we are going to use string as the type for Micro Charts instead of sap.m.ValueCSSColor. The value will only support MicroChartColorType from the SAPUI5 2.0 release.

properties.name: deltaDisplayValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it is rendered instead of a calculated delta.

properties.name: displayValue1
properties.description: If this property is set, it is rendered instead of value1.

properties.name: displayValue2
properties.description: If this property is set, it is rendered instead of value2.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description:
If this set to true, width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the container in which the control is placed. Size and Width properties are ignored in such case.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.61.0. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the microchart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the delta micro chart is included.

properties.name: title1
properties.description: The first value title.

properties.name: title2
properties.description: The second value title.

properties.name: value1
properties.description: The first value for delta calculation.

properties.name: value2
properties.description: The second value for delta calculation.

properties.name: view
properties.description:
The view of the chart. If not set, the Normal view is used by default.

Since: 1.61.0.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChartViewType
symbols.description:
Lists the views of the delta micro chart concerning the position of titles.

This enum is part of the 'sap/suite/ui/microchart/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'DeltaMicroChartViewType'.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChartViewType.Normal
properties.description: Titles are displayed above the bars.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChartViewType.Responsive
properties.description: Behavior changes based on the current width of the chart. Normal view is used for charts up to 192px wide, and Wide is used for wider charts.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChartViewType.Wide
properties.description: Titles are displayed in the same line with the bars.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.microchart.DeltaMicroChartViewType

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChart
symbols.description:
A radial chart that displays a value compared to its total.
Unlike a pie chart, which shows multiple values or sectors, a Harvey Ball microchart shows only one value from a total.
The sector that represents a value being compared to a total is defined by sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChartItem.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: alignContent
properties.description:
The alignment of the content. If not set, the Left alignment type is used.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: colorPalette
properties.description:
The color palette for the chart. Currently only a single color (first color in the array) is supported.
If this property is defined, the semantic color defined in the sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChartItem is ignored.

properties.name: formattedLabel
properties.description:
If set to true, the totalLabel property is used instead of the combination of the total value and its scaling factor.
The default value is false, which means that the total value, defined by the total property, and the scaling factor, defined by the totalScale property, are displayed separately.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description:
If set to true, the width and height of the control are determined by the width and height of the parent container, in which case the size and width properties are ignored.

Since: 1.38.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.62.0. the concept has been discarded.

properties.name: showFractions
properties.description: If set to true, the fraction values are displayed next to the chart. The default setting is true.

properties.name: showTotal
properties.description: If set to true, the total value is displayed next to the chart. The default setting is true.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the chart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the device type.

properties.name: total
properties.description: The total value. The total value is represented by a full circle, or 360 degrees value on the chart.

properties.name: totalLabel
properties.description: The total label. If specified, it is displayed instead of the total value.

properties.name: totalScale
properties.description: The scaling factor that is displayed next to the total value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The set of items. Currently only a single item is supported.

symbols.description: Defines the fraction value that is compared with total in a sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChart.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color of the sector representing the fraction value.
The same color is used for the fraction value label defined either by the fraction property or by the fractionLabel property. For SAPUI5 1.x releases, we are going to use string as the type for Micro Charts instead of sap.m.ValueCSSColor. The value will only support MicroChartColorType from the SAPUI5 2.0 release.

properties.name: formattedLabel
properties.description:
If set to true, the fractionLabel property is used instead of the combination of the fraction value and scaling factor.
The default value is false, which means that the fraction value, defined by the fraction property, and the scaling factor, defined by the fractionScale property are displayed separately.

properties.name: fraction
properties.description:
The fraction value that defines the size of the colored sector.
This property must be set to a value that is a fraction of the total value defined for the sap.suite.ui.microchart.HarveyBallMicroChart.

properties.name: fractionLabel
properties.description: The fraction label. If this property is specified, it is displayed instead of the label that is based on the fraction property.

properties.name: fractionScale
properties.description: The scaling factor that is displayed after the fraction value.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.microchart.InteractiveLineChartPoint

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart
symbols.description:
Chart that displays the history of values as segmented lines along a threshold line. The scale is optional and showing the points is also optional.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
Describes the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, it is only used if all points have the sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral color.
The color can be set as an sap.m.ValueCSSColor or as a plain object. It has the 'above|' and 'below' properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.


The color property of sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine has priority over this property in case it is set.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: leftBottomLabel
properties.description: Describes the left bottom label of the chart. The label color is set internally. The space for the label is not reserved if the label is not set.

properties.name: leftTopLabel
properties.description: Describes the left top label of the chart. The label color is determined by the color property of the first LineMicroChartPoint in the points aggregation. The space for the label is not reserved if the label is not set.

properties.name: maxXValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it indicates the value the X-axis ends with.

properties.name: maxYValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it indicates the value the Y-axis ends with.

properties.name: minXValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it indicates the value the X-axis starts with.

properties.name: minYValue
properties.description: If this property is set, it indicates the value the Y-axis starts with.

properties.name: rightBottomLabel
properties.description: Describes the right bottom label of the chart. The label color is set automatically. The space for the label is not reserved if the label is not set.

properties.name: rightTopLabel
properties.description: Describes the right top label of the chart. The label color is determined by the color property of the last LineMicroChartPoint in the points aggregation. The space for the label is not reserved if the label is not set.

properties.name: showBottomLabels
properties.description: If this property is set to false, both bottom labels are hidden.

properties.name: showPoints
properties.description:
Defines if the control renders the points or not.
If emphasized points are used, there is no effect.
If the value is true, the points in the aggregation are shown.


The showPoints property of the sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine control has priority over this property in case it is set.

properties.name: showThresholdLine
properties.description: If this property is set to false, the threshold line is hidden.

properties.name: showThresholdValue
properties.description:
If this property is set to false, the threshold value is hidden.
If this property is set to true, the value will be shown only if the showThresholdLine property is also set to true.

properties.name: showTopLabels
properties.description: If this property is set to false, both top labels are hidden.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the chart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the type of the device.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Determines the chart threshold which is used for vertical normalization. If the threshold does not belong to the value range given by minYValue...maxYValue, the threshold is ignored. By setting the threshold property's value to null, the threshold is disabled and excluded from range calculations.

properties.name: thresholdDisplayValue
properties.description: Overrides the threshold value with a string that is shown instead.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: _line
aggregations.description: sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine for the cases when a single line with the legacy points aggregation is used. Rest of the control can than work with LineMicroChartLines, regardless of this use case.

aggregations.name: lines
aggregations.description:
Aggregation that containes lines with data points.
This aggregation should be used instead of the points aggregation.

aggregations.name: points
aggregations.description:
Aggregation that contains all data points that should be provided in an ordered way. If both the points and lines aggregations are used, the chart is rendered based on the points aggregation, while the lines from the lines aggregations are ignored.
The points aggregation can be used to ensure backward compatibility. However in general, the lines aggregation should be preferred.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

Since: 1.60.0.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
Determines the color of the emphasized point. The property has an effect only if the 'show' property is true. If at least one emphasized point has a color different from Neutral, the graph is grey; otherwise, the graph is blue.

For SAPUI5 1.x releases, we are going to use string as the type for Micro Charts instead of sap.m.ValueCSSColor. The value (or type, or property) will only support MicroChartColorType from the SAPUI5 2.0 release.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChartLine
symbols.description: The container containing all the points of the line.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
Defines the color of the chart.
In conjunction with emphasized points, this property is only used if all points have the sap.m.ValueColor.Neutral color. The color can be set as an sap.m.ValueCSSColor or as a plain object. It has the above and below properties that determine the color of the graph above and below the threshold, respectively.


This property has priority over the property color of sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart in case it is set.
If this property is not defined, the value of the color property from the parent sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart is used instead.

properties.name: showPoints
properties.description:
Defines whether the points are shown.
If emphasized points are used, this property is ignored.
If this property is set to true, the points in the points aggregation are shown.


This property has priority over the property showPoints of sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart in case it is set.
If this property is not defined, the showPoints property of the sap.suite.ui.microchart.LineMicroChart is used instead.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the type of the line.

aggregations.name: points
aggregations.description:
Aggregation that contains all data points that should be provided in an ordered way.


Note: Points can be bound without template/factory method.
This approach is more efficient when many points are used, because no new objects will be created for them and only their representation in the model will be kept. See the samples .
To use emphasized points, the emphasized property has to be set in the model of the point and can be used together with the properties show and color, as shown in the sample. When this binding method is used, the #getPoints method will always return an empty array.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.MicroChartColorType
symbols.description:
Colors to highlight certain UI chart elements.

Instead of the ValueState, semantic colors must be defined by the application.

This enum is part of the 'sap/suite/ui/microchart/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'MicroChartColorType'.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart
symbols.description:
Displays a ring chart highlighting a current status. The status is displayed with a semantically colored radial bar and a percentage value.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string.

properties.name: alignContent
properties.description:
The alignment of the content. If it is not set, the Left alignment type is used.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: fraction
properties.description: The fraction of the total value that is displayed.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: percentage
properties.description: The percentage that is displayed. When a percentage is set, properties total and fraction are not considered.

properties.name: showPercentageSymbol
properties.description:
If set to true, the percentage symbol(%) is displayed. If set to false, the percentage symbol(%) is not displayed.

Since: 1.121.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.123.0. Setting this property does not have any impact on the display of the percentage symbol(%)

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The size of the chart. If it is not set, the Auto size is used.

Since: 1.44.0.

properties.name: total
properties.description: The total value. This is taken as 360 degrees value on the chart.

properties.name: valueColor
properties.description: The color shown in the completed path. For SAPUI5 1.x releases, we are going to use string as the type for Micro Charts instead of sap.m.ValueCSSColor. The value (or type, or property) will only support MicroChartColorType from the SAPUI5 2.0 release.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

Since: 1.62.0.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.microchart.StackedBarMicroChart
symbols.description:
Illustrates values as stacked and colored bar charts displaying numeric values (as absolute values or percentages) inside the bars.
Note: You can assign a custom tooltip for this microchart. The custom tooltip can be set using expression binding. When no custom tooltip is defined, the tooltip is generated automatically based on the logic described in sap.ui.core.Element#getTooltip_AsString. For a combination of a generated and a custom tooltip, use ((AltText)) inside of the tooltip string. The aggregated data of the microchart can also be customized.

properties.name: displayZeroValue
properties.description:
Defines whether stacked bars with zero value should be rendered. The default is true where these zero value stacked bars are rendered with a minimum width of 0.25rem.

Since: 1.76.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the chart. Overrides the height specified in the size property.

properties.name: hideOnNoData
properties.description:
If this is set to True, the control will be hidden in 'No data' scenario.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: maxValue
properties.description: The maximum value can be set to scale StackedBarMicroChartBar values to the same base. If maxValue is smaller than the sum of all StackedMicroChartBar values, the maxValue is ignored. All values are shown as percentage values (same behavior as maxValue is not used). If maxValue is equal or bigger than the sum of all StackedMicroChartBars, all values are scaled to the value of maxValue and the percentage mode is turned off. Absolute values are shown instead. The difference between the sum and maxValue is shown as invisible bar, thus e.g. different StackedBarMicroChart instances can be compared.

properties.name: precision
properties.description: The precision of the rounding for the calculated percentage values of the bars. It defines how many digits after the decimal point are displayed. The default is set to 1 digit.

properties.name: showLabels
properties.description: Defines whether the bar labels should be rendered. If set to true, the labels that were specified for each bar become visible.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the chart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the stacked bar micro chart is included.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the chart. Overrides the width specified in the size property.

aggregations.name: bars
aggregations.description: The stacked bar chart items.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

Since: 1.60.0.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property size.

The size of the chart. If not set, the default size is applied based on the size of the device tile. Responsive size takes width and height of the parent container where the stacked bar micro chart is included.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Auto.
